title: Aluminum Rebounds from 1-Month Low
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK rose to $2,909.20 per tonne on December 5, 2025, up 0.26% from the previous day, recovering from a near one-month low of $2,790 on November 18. The price increase was supported by macroeconomic tailwinds, including favorable monetary policy signals from the Fed and fresh stimulus from Beijing to address its property crisis. Over the past month, aluminum prices have risen 2.29%, and are up 11.51% compared to the same time last year.

title: Aluminum Prices Hit 3-Year High: Is It the Next Key Metal in the Clean Energy Shift?
summary: Aluminum prices surged to around $2,800 per tonne, reaching a three-year high driven by rising demand from electric vehicles, solar power, and grid upgrades. Supply constraints include China's power shortages, environmental production limits, and unrest in Guinea, a major bauxite supplier. The market is tightening with LME inventories at their lowest since 2021, and low-carbon aluminum commands a premium due to growing demand for verified low-emission materials.

title: Alcoa: High US Aluminum Prices Offset Trump Tariff Costs
summary: Alcoa Corp. reported that despite $69 million in additional costs from U.S. tariffs on Canadian aluminum, higher domestic aluminum prices have more than offset these tariff impacts. The U.S. Midwest premium has surged 113% since early June 2025 due to trade measures. Alcoa expects tariff costs to increase further in Q4 2025 but continues to normalize shipments from Canada to the U.S.

title: Aluminum Price Analysis Report: July 2025 and Outlook for the Second Half of the Year
summary: In July 2025, LME aluminum prices fluctuated between $2,557 and $2,657 per metric ton. Several financial institutions forecast aluminum prices for 2025 ranging from $2,280 to $2,800 per ton, with expectations of a market shift from surplus to deficit in the second half of the year. Key factors supporting prices include China's production caps, declining exports, and rising U.S. domestic premiums driven by tariffs, although risks remain from China's economic recovery and potential drought.

title: Year-end consumption weakened coupled with high aluminum price suppression, the operating rate of aluminum processors came under pressure and pulled back to 61.9%: Aluminum Processing Weekly Survey
summary: The operating rate of leading domestic aluminum downstream processing enterprises fell slightly to 61.9%, with stable primary aluminum alloy production but cautious demand due to high aluminum prices. Structural differences in industry orders were significant, with declines in construction and packaging sectors, and no substantial improvement expected in the short term as off-season deepens and environmental controls persist.

title: Aluminum Prices Rise Amid Supply Constraints and Production Caps
summary: Aluminum prices rose to $2,909.20 per ton, driven by supply decreases and China's efforts to curb overcapacity in metal production. China plans to slow output next year due to a 45 million ton cap and faces setbacks in building smelters in Indonesia due to energy costs and regulations. Additional supply disruptions include a potline suspension at Iceland’s Grundartangi smelter and Alcoa's closure of its Kwinana alumina refinery in Australia.

title: Alcoa: High US Aluminum Prices Offset Trump Tariff Costs
summary: Alcoa reported that despite $69 million in additional costs from U.S. tariffs on Canadian aluminum imports, rising domestic aluminum prices have more than offset these costs. The company expects tariff costs to increase further in Q4 2025. The tariffs, initially set by the Trump administration, have caused the U.S. Midwest premium on aluminum to jump significantly this year.

title: COMMENTARY: Scarcity of aluminum means it's time to recondition faster
summary: A fire at Novelis' aluminum production facility in Oswego, NY, has caused a significant supply shock for the automotive industry, impacting major automakers like Ford and Toyota. The disruption is expected to last until early 2026, severely constraining new vehicle production and shifting consumer demand toward the used vehicle market. This highlights the need for faster vehicle reconditioning to maintain dealership profitability amid aluminum scarcity.

title: ALUPCO pioneers sustainable aluminium for the energy transition era
summary: ALUPCO has implemented technological upgrades including automation and Industry 4.0 tools, and strategic partnerships to advance sustainable aluminium production. The company focuses on recycling programs, producing 'green billets', and energy-efficient processes, aligning with LEED standards and circular economy principles. An upcoming IPO aims to fund expansion in solar-frame and low-carbon extrusion lines, positioning ALUPCO as a global leader in low-carbon aluminium solutions.

title: Unilever, Ball and Alcoa unveil “first” carbon-free aluminum aerosol can
summary: Ball Corporation, Unilever, and Alcoa introduced the first aerosol can made using Elysis carbon-free smelting technology, combining 50% Elysis aluminum with 50% recycled content. This innovation eliminates direct greenhouse gas emissions from smelting by producing oxygen instead of CO2, marking a significant step in decarbonizing aluminum packaging for personal care products.

title: Aluminum Recycling Market to Reach US$91.3 Billion by 2032 as Global Demand for Low-Carbon Metals & Circular Manufacturing Surges
summary: The aluminum recycling industry is rapidly evolving with technological innovations such as hydrogen-powered remelting furnaces and AI-guided scrap sorting systems to reduce carbon emissions and increase efficiency. Recycling aluminum uses 95% less energy than primary production, supporting circular economy principles and meeting growing demand, especially in electric vehicles requiring high aluminum content.

title: Aluminum stabilizes high-nickel cathodes, curbing rapid capacity loss in EV batteries
summary: Researchers at POSTECH discovered that substituting a small amount of nickel with aluminum in high-nickel cathodes stabilizes the battery structure by reducing oxygen-related lattice distortions, significantly enhancing EV battery lifespan and safety. This innovation addresses capacity degradation and thermal runaway risks, potentially impacting the rechargeable battery industry broadly.

title: MADMEC winners develop spray-on coating to protect power lines from ice
summary: The MIT team developed a spray-on coating for aluminum power lines that prevents ice formation, enhancing durability and reducing outage costs. Tested under simulated freezing conditions, the coating accommodates strain and could save millions in repair costs, supporting sustainable infrastructure resilience in cold climates.

title: Steel rebar futures in China rise above CNY 3,100 per tonne, highest in three months
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose above CNY 3,100 per tonne in early December, marking the highest level in three months. This rise is attributed to lower supply and government support measures, despite weak near-term demand. The Chinese government is considering new measures to support the property market, which is the largest source of global rebar demand.

title: HRC Steel price trends and recent fluctuations
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel prices rose slightly to 908 USD/T on December 5, 2025, up 0.22% from the previous day, but also fell to 903.04 USD/T the same day, showing volatility. Over the past month, HRC Steel prices increased by 6.62% and are up 31.07% compared to the previous year, reflecting ongoing market dynamics.

title: Steel Price Trend Charts 2025: Global Analysis & Forecasts
summary: Steel prices have shown volatility in 2025, with U.S. Hot-Rolled Coil futures trading around $860/ton in December 2025 and a 52-week range of $778 to $888/ton. Chinese steel rebar futures were up 5.74% month-over-month in August 2025 but face downward pressure from tariffs and oversupply. A price recovery is forecasted for 2027, contingent on demand rebound and supply rationalization.

title: American steel producers are gradually raising prices for rolled products
summary: American steel producers, including Nucor Bar Group, are increasing prices for rolled steel products. Nucor raised the cost of all types of rebar by $30 per short ton for new orders received after November 7, reflecting a trend of gradual price increases in the U.S. steel market.

title: U.S. Steel to resume steel production at Illinois plant shut 3 years ago
summary: U.S. Steel announced it will restart steel slab production at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois, reversing its previous shutdown decision from 2023. The company cited strong customer demand and plans to resume production in the first half of 2026 after hiring and training workers. This move follows pressure from the White House and reflects a robust U.S. steel market strengthened by tariffs and increased demand in automaking and construction.

title: U.S. Steel to restart second blast furnace at Granite City Works
summary: U.S. Steel announced plans to restart its second blast furnace at the Granite City Works plant, aiming to hire 400 workers to operate it. The decision is seen as a positive development for the local steel community amid concerns about the plant's future following Nippon Steel's takeover. The company did not specify investment amounts for this restart but emphasized the importance of continuing high-quality steel production.

title: US Steel to resume steel production at Illinois plant shut 2 years ago
summary: U.S. Steel plans to resume steel slab production at its Granite City Works plant in Illinois, citing strengthening demand and reversing earlier shutdown decisions. The company expects to restart production in the first half of 2026 after hiring and training workers. The robust U.S. steel market benefits from tariffs and growth in automaking and construction sectors.

title: ArcelorMittal France to Launch New Electrical Steel Production Line
summary: ArcelorMittal France announced that the first three lines of its new electrical steel production line at the Mardyck industrial site will come online by the end of 2025. This development marks a significant expansion in their steel production capacity focused on electrical steel products.

title: October Steel Shipments Down 4.2 Percent From Prior Month
summary: Steel shipments in the U.S. decreased by 4.2% in October compared to the previous month but remain up 5.1% year-to-date compared to the same period in 2024. This data reflects ongoing fluctuations in steel demand and production capacity utilization.

title: Japan's Steel Sector Needs to Use All Low-Carbon Pathways to Reach Emissions Goal
summary: Japan's steel industry must adopt all available low-emission pathways, including increased scrap steel recycling and clean power use, to meet its 2050 net zero emissions target. The report emphasizes the need for unified green steel standards and long-term infrastructure planning to support decarbonization and cost competitiveness.

title: Steelmaking Decarbonisation
summary: BHP highlights the challenge of decarbonizing steel production while meeting rising global demand. The company supports multiple technology pathways, including carbon capture and renewable energy, aiming for a 30% reduction in greenhouse gas emissions intensity by post-2030 adoption.

title: Innovations Redefining Construction with Steel
summary: New steel technologies such as robotic wire-arc additive manufacturing (3D printing), diagrid frames for material efficiency, and digital delivery methods like BIM and digital twins are transforming construction. These innovations improve speed, efficiency, durability, and reduce the carbon footprint of steel structures.

title: World's First General Design Approval (GDA) for Developed Steel and Post-Weld Heat Treatment (PWHT) Exemption Based on ECA for Low-Pressure Liquefied CO2 Tanks
summary: Nippon Steel and Mitsubishi Shipbuilding received the world's first GDA for steel used in large low-pressure liquefied CO2 tanks, enabling safer and more economical CO2 transportation. This breakthrough supports carbon neutrality goals by advancing steel products and manufacturing processes that reduce CO2 emissions in the CCUS value chain.

title: Breakthrough Technology Conference 2025
summary: The worldsteel Breakthrough Technology Conference 2025 in Singapore provided a platform for technical experts to discuss and explore decarbonization technologies for the steel industry. Presentations from the event are available, highlighting innovations critical to achieving sustainable steel production.

title: Comex Copper Ends the Week 3.79% Higher at $5.3820
summary: Front Month Comex Copper for December delivery gained 3.79% this week, reaching $5.3820 per pound. This marks the largest one-week net and percentage gain since early October 2025, with prices up six of the past eight sessions and the highest settlement since July 30, 2025. Year-to-date, copper is up 35.02%, though still 7.13% off its 52-week high.

title: Copper price extends record run as Citi makes bullish call
summary: Copper futures on the London Metal Exchange rose as much as 2.2% to $11,705 a ton, surpassing previous records amid expectations of a global supply shortage. Citigroup forecasted prices could reach $13,000 a ton by Q2 2026, driven by a US inventory buildup and supply squeeze. However, some analysts warn prices above $11,000 may not be sustainable due to market volatility and uncertain end-use demand.

title: Copper Touches another Record High
summary: Benchmark three-month copper on the LME hit an all-time peak of $11,705 before settling slightly lower at $11,616. Citi raised its price outlook to an average of $13,000 in Q2 2026, citing supply shortages and expectations of a Fed rate cut. Glencore also lowered its 2026 copper production guidance, supporting the bullish market sentiment.

title: Copper Hits All-Time Highs! Scrap Prices Surge Heading Into December 2025
summary: Copper futures have broken all-time price records driven largely by speculative buying and algorithmic trading rather than strong demand fundamentals. The rally surprised many professionals despite weak mill demand in major markets. Investor flows, thin London inventories, and uncertainty around US trade policy are key factors behind the surge.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper prices rose to $5.37 per pound on December 5, 2025, up 1.96% from the previous day and up 8.45% over the past month. The price increase is linked to supply disruptions and a large withdrawal of metal from LME warehouses, fueling speculation of a supply squeeze. Copper is up nearly 30% compared to the same time last year.

title: Ivanhoe Mines Announces Kamoa-Kakula Copper Production Guidance for 2026 and 2027 as Recovery Plan Advances
summary: Ivanhoe Mines projects copper production at its Kamoa-Kakula complex to range between 380,000 and 420,000 tonnes in 2026, increasing to 500,000 to 540,000 tonnes in 2027. The company expects copper sales in 2026 to exceed production due to destocking of surplus concentrate inventory. Production rates are anticipated to improve steadily as recovery efforts at the Kakula Mine progress.

title: Glencore Targets Annual Copper Production of 1.6 Million Tons by 2035
summary: Glencore announced plans to restart its Alumbrera copper mine in Argentina by the fourth quarter of 2026, aiming for production to begin in the first half of 2028. The company targets annual copper production of around 1.6 million tons by 2035, with an intermediate goal of exceeding 1 million tons by the end of 2028. Alumbrera is expected to produce approximately 75,000 tons of copper over four years once fully operational.

title: Glencore Capital Markets Day 2025
summary: At its 2025 Capital Markets Day, Glencore outlined a pathway to increase copper production to about 1 million tonnes annually by 2028 and 1.6 million tonnes by 2035. The company highlighted significant progress in de-risking its copper portfolio, including the planned restart of the Alumbrera mine in Argentina, expected to resume operations in late 2026 with first production in 2028.

title: Copper Touches another Record High
summary: Copper prices reached a new record high, supported by Citi's raised price outlook and expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut. Supply concerns and structural support from tight supply outside the US contributed to the price surge. Meanwhile, Glencore lowered its 2026 copper production guidance, and Chinese copper smelters plan to cut production by over 10% in 2026 to address industry overcapacity.

title: Glencore to restart production at Alumbrera copper mine in Argentina
summary: Glencore plans to restart operations at its Alumbrera copper mine in Argentina by the end of 2026, with production expected to begin in the first half of 2028. The decision is driven by a favorable tax regime, rising copper and gold prices, and a positive outlook for these commodities. Alumbrera was the last copper producer in Argentina before its 2018 closure.

title: Chile, Peru, Brazil and Argentina Look to the Copper Boom with Optimism
summary: South American copper producers Chile, Peru, Brazil, and Argentina are optimistic about the copper boom driven by global demand for energy transition metals. Traditional producers like Chile and Peru are well positioned, while Brazil and Argentina aim to become major suppliers. The market shows a clear upward trend in copper prices amid volatility and rising inventories, with strong demand expected to grow exponentially by 2050.

title: Chile to reach milestones in 13 copper projects worth US$14.8bn in 2026 amid a bull market
summary: Chile is set to achieve milestones in 13 copper projects valued at US$14.8 billion in 2026, reflecting a strong bull market for copper. These developments underscore Chile's role as a leading copper producer amid rising global demand and favorable market conditions.

title: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology produces first copper
summary: Rio Tinto has successfully produced its first copper using Nuton technology at the Johnson Camp mine in Arizona. This marks a technological advancement in copper production, potentially improving efficiency and sustainability in mining operations.

title: RIO Boosts Copper Innovation With First Copper Output Using Nuton Technology
summary: Rio Tinto announced the first copper production from the Johnson Camp mine in Arizona using its Nuton Technology, which combines biology, chemistry, engineering, and digital tools to enable cleaner, faster, and more efficient copper production. Nuton eliminates traditional concentration, smelting, and refining steps, reducing water use by up to 80% and carbon emissions by up to 60%, aiming to produce copper with the lowest carbon footprint in the U.S.

title: Gunnison Copper Announces That Rio Tinto's Nuton Technology Produces First Copper
summary: After over 30 years of R&D, Rio Tinto's Nuton bioleaching technology produced its first copper cathode at the Johnson Camp mine, using microorganisms grown onsite. The technology is expected to use 80% less water and emit 60% less carbon than conventional methods, producing copper with a mine-to-metal carbon footprint of 0.82 kg CO₂-e/kg copper, the lowest in the U.S., supported by 100% renewable electricity.

title: Rio Tinto advances Nuton copper processing technology at Johnson Camp mine
summary: Rio Tinto achieved a milestone with the first copper produced using Nuton technology, which uses bioleaching to extract copper directly at the mine, bypassing traditional smelting and refining. Nuton can recover up to 85% from primary sulphides, extend mine life, and reduce environmental impact with a projected carbon footprint of 0.82 kg CO₂-e/kg copper and water usage of 71 liters/kg copper.

title: Recycled Copper Market - Forecasts from 2025 to 2030: Opportunities in Rising Demand from Rapid Infrastructural Developments
summary: The global recycled copper market is growing due to its environmental benefits, using approximately 85% less energy than primary copper production. Rising infrastructure development, especially in Asia-Pacific and the Middle East, and government regulations promoting recycled copper use are driving demand. Recycling copper reduces landfill waste and conserves fossil fuels, supporting sustainable resource management.

title: Critical metals innovator pH7 raises $25.6M to scale copper extraction technology
summary: pH7 Technologies secured $25.6 million to commercialize its organo-electrochemical copper extraction technology that recovers metals from lower-grade ores and uneconomic feedstocks. The closed-loop process reduces energy consumption and wastewater generation, offering a sustainable alternative to traditional high-waste extraction methods and supporting domestic critical metals supply chains.

title: Chile, Peru, Brazil and Argentina Look to the Copper Boom with Optimism
summary: Latin American countries are optimistic about copper's role in clean technologies and the energy transition, with copper being essential for solar panels, wind turbines, and electrical grids. New copper projects in the region emphasize ESG (Environmental, Social, and Governance) principles to ensure sustainability and minimize environmental and social impacts, aligning with carbon market requirements.

title: LME nickel price rises for 2 consecutive days due to falling US dollar
summary: LME nickel futures rose by US$290 on December 7, closing at US$16,508/ton, while the spot price increased by US$291.5 to US$16,306/ton. The price rise is attributed to the falling US dollar, supporting nickel prices.

title: Nickel prices were in the doldrums this week, with domestic inventory increasing slightly
summary: Nickel prices showed sideways movement this week, oscillating between $14,700/mt and $14,900/mt on the LME and SHFE markets. Despite weak demand and sluggish trading, expectations of a US Fed interest rate cut and progress in geopolitical conflicts provided some support, while LME nickel inventory remained high at over 250,000 mt.

title: LME's nickel price soars on Dec 7 on crisis concerns & Indonesia's policy
summary: The LME nickel price surged by US$2,170/ton on December 7, closing at US$31,441/ton amid crisis concerns and policy developments in Indonesia affecting the nickel market. The nickel spot price also saw a significant increase.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in December period I
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association announced benchmark prices for nickel ore for early December 2025, setting the reference price at $14,666.67/wmt, down 2.21% from late November. Prices for different nickel content grades also decreased slightly compared to the previous period.

title: Vale Foresees Higher Iron Ore, Copper & Nickel Production Next Year
summary: Vale projects a 10% increase in nickel production for 2026, targeting 170,000-200,000 tons, alongside a 3% rise in iron ore and copper output. The company aims to become the world's largest iron ore producer and plans capital investments of $5.4 to $5.7 billion for 2026.

title: FLASH: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in December period I
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association announced benchmark prices for nickel ore for early December 2025, showing a decrease of about 2.21% from late November. Prices vary by nickel content grade, with the highest grade (Ni 2.0%) priced at $40.04/wmt, down from previous periods.

title: US minerals projects seek 'industrial vision' from Washington to compete with China
summary: US nickel industry leaders urge the government to implement a comprehensive minerals plan, including pressuring Indonesia to limit nickel production, which currently accounts for about 60% of global supply and has depressed prices. The US aims to accelerate domestic nickel refining capacity, with a refinery planned in Oklahoma by 2030.

title: Supply Chains Struggle as Energy Transition Drives Surging Demand for Metals: BloombergNEF Finds
summary: BloombergNEF reports that rising demand for critical metals including nickel is outpacing supply chain capacity amid the global energy transition. Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines, has expanded nickel production, but refining capacity remains concentrated in China, posing supply chain risks.

title: Critical metals innovator pH7 raises $25.6M
summary: Vancouver-based pH7 Technologies secured $25.6 million to scale its electrochemical extraction technology for critical metals including nickel. The technology enables profitable recovery from lower-grade ores and previously uneconomic sources, supporting sustainable and domestic supply chains for nickel and other metals.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals’ TECH Project aims to become the world’s premier source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel to support the green transition. The project uses an environmentally friendly DNi Process with over 98% nitric acid recycling and no tailings dam, promising a carbon-negative, sustainable nickel production facility for EV and energy storage industries.

title: Nickel at a crossroads: conform or reform
summary: The global nickel market is undergoing a shift due to evolving battery chemistries and demand patterns, with increased focus on recycling and domestic supply chains in North America. Companies like Redwood Materials are advancing circular recovery of nickel from battery waste, aiming to reduce import dependence and environmental impact while meeting rising ESG standards.

title: Breakthrough Tech Yields 99% Pure Nickel, Cobalt
summary: A research team at UNIST developed an innovative electrochemical recycling technology that recovers over 95% of nickel and cobalt from waste batteries with purity exceeding 99%. This sustainable method reduces chemical use and wastewater generation, potentially transforming the battery recycling industry by enabling a more efficient and environmentally friendly recovery process.

title: ZincFive Raises $30M for AI Data Center Batteries
summary: ZincFive's patented nickel-zinc battery technology offers superior power density, safety, and sustainability compared to lead-acid and lithium-ion batteries. With nearly a decade of proven performance, this technology supports AI-ready infrastructure with a compact environmental footprint and minimal maintenance requirements.

title: Aluminum stabilizes high-nickel cathodes, curbing rapid capacity loss in EV batteries
summary: Research led by Professor Kyu-Young Park identified that aluminum addition stabilizes high-nickel cathodes in EV batteries, reducing structural distortion and capacity degradation. This advancement could improve both energy density and lifespan of batteries, enhancing performance and safety for next-generation electric vehicles.

title: Critical metals innovator pH7 raises $25.6M
summary: pH7 has raised $25.6 million to advance its closed-loop organo-electrochemical extraction technology that recovers metals like nickel from lower-grade ores and uneconomic feedstocks. The process reduces energy consumption and wastewater generation, supporting resilient domestic supply chains and sustainable metal recovery for the energy transition.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalises a 200 million euro share capital increase and the acquisition of Special Melted Products in UK
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali completed a significant capital increase of 200 million euros and acquired Special Melted Products, a UK-based company specializing in high value-added materials primarily for aerospace, energy, and nuclear sectors. This move supports the company's growth and expansion strategy in specialty steel markets.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne finalizes Mannesmann tubes acquisition to expand stainless footprint
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali finalized the acquisition of Mannesmann Stainless Tubes from German steelmaker Salzgitter for €135 million. This acquisition expands Cogne's footprint in seamless tubes and stainless steel nickel alloy pipes, enhancing its competitiveness and integration in the market.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of the electricity used by the group comes from certified renewable sources. The company emphasizes sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and reports a high rate of permanent employment contracts.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne initiates another three-month temporary layoffs round
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has notified trade unions about implementing a second temporary layoff scheme this year, reflecting ongoing adjustments in response to market conditions in the stainless steel sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali started operations at a green hydrogen pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, marking a step towards sustainable steel production and innovation in energy use within the steel industry.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Tenaris S A : Weekly Report (December 1, 2025 - December 5, 2025)
summary: Tenaris announced its intention to cancel treasury shares purchased under its share buyback programs. The report details recent transactions involving share purchases on various trading venues and provides insights into the company's financial management and outlook amid market uncertainties.

title: Tenaris remains profitable in 2025
summary: Tenaris reported a $37 million profit in Q3 2025, a 15.6% increase from the previous quarter but a 22.9% decrease compared to Q3 2024. The company highlighted steady sales in the North American oil and gas tube market despite tariff increases and some regional activity fluctuations, maintaining resilient drilling activity overall.

title: Tenaris reduced pipe sales to 2.95 million tons in January-September
summary: Tenaris sold 2.95 million tons of pipe products in the first nine months of 2025, marking a 2% decrease compared to the same period in the previous year. This reduction reflects market challenges impacting the company's sales volume internationally.

title: Prysmian shares rise as Italian cable maker seen as winner amid US copper tariffs
source: Reuters via Global Banking & Finance Review
summary: Prysmian's shares rose nearly 4% following the announcement of a 50% US tariff on imported copper. The Italian cable maker is considered a relative winner due to its vertical integration in the US copper supply chain, sourcing copper domestically and operating its own copper rod mill, which gives it a competitive edge. The company is well positioned to benefit from the tariff despite ongoing assessment of its final impact.

title: World's top cable maker sees US copper tariff as opportunity
summary: Prysmian views the US 50% copper tariff as a positive development that will strengthen the American supply chain. The company, which acquired Texas-based Encore Wire, sources much of its copper domestically and is vertically integrated, positioning it better than competitors. Prysmian is in regular contact with the US administration and expects the tariff to support local business and reinforce its leadership in the US market.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting better-than-expected Q3 results, driven by strong growth in Renewable Transmission and Power Grids segments. The company noted steady performance in North America and Europe, with a stable high-voltage backlog of about €16 billion. Analysts suggest Prysmian has not yet fully realized benefits from copper tariffs but expects positive impacts in 2026.

title: Prysmian Group invests €350 million to expand cable-laying vessel fleet and production capacity
summary: Prysmian Group announced a €350 million investment to add two new cable-laying vessels and expand production capacity for submarine cables, including in its Italian plant in Arco Felice. This investment supports growing demand for submarine cable systems driven by energy transition needs in Europe and the US. The company is strengthening its global strategy with hubs in Northern Europe, the Mediterranean (Italy), and the US to serve expanding markets.
